subject: p18487334
History: Year old man with cough, aspiration risk, eval for consolidation.
Findings: The lung volumes are stable. A new right lower lung opacification. The cardio mediastinal and hilar borders are stable. The pleural surfaces are stable. The left pacemaker is intact with leads in appropriate positions. Again seen, is destruction in the second sternotomy wire. The OG tube appears to be malpositioned proximally lying in the proximal fundus of the stomach. The right PICC line terminates in the mid SVC. The osseous structures are stable.
Impression: New right lower lung opacity may represent aspiration, less likely atelectasis. Malpositioning of the OG tube. Recommend advancement of the tube.
